bill_title: permit certain municipalities to provide to residents of sanitary districts upon petition.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to permit certain municipalities to provide to residents of sanitary districts upon petition. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. Notwithstanding the provisions of § § 34A-5-42 to 34A-5-44, inclusive, any resident of a municipality served by a sanitary district may petition the municipal governing body for service by the municipality. If the municipality agrees to provide service as requested in the petition, the governing body shall approve a resolution stating the intent of the municipality to provide such service, the anticipated date service by the municipality will begin, and the area which shall be served by the municipality. The resolution shall be forwarded to the sanitary district and the county commission, whereupon, the sanitary district shall revise its boundaries to show the exclusion of the relevant territory from the district. Section 2. The provisions of this Act apply only to that portion of the state west of the one hundred and second meridian. 250 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.038 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

action_log.status_text: First read in Senate and referred to
